item.title: Strangeloop 2018
item.description:
Strangeloop 2018

Strangeloop 2018 is a conference held every year in St. Louis. It features speakers from academia, the software industry, and even a museum party at the City Museum held the night before the conference starts!

item.title: PWLConf 2018 Running Notes
item.description:
PWLConf 2018 Notes

PWLConf 2018 was one of the preconferences at Strangeloop 2018. Here are my notes for the conference. I left out the last talk, Stable Fluids, but if you find computer animation interesting I urge you to check it out.

item.title: About me
item.description: I’m a dad and software engineer. I live in the mountains of North Carolina, and currently work as a Product Engineer at Zapier. I’ve worked for a few other organizations, but the work I’m most proud of is my time as an electrician in the Navy, and my research for Dr. Souvenir in Computer Vision and Machine Learing. When I’m not parenting or working, which account for 70% of my waking hours (!
